body: LEAD: SOMETIME next year, probably in the summer, condominiums at a new waterfront development called Jonathan's Landing are to go on sale. To find them, prospective buyers will drive along a new road on a sliver of landfill that juts into Gravesend Bay on the South Brooklyn shore. title: Perspectives: Waterfront Development; Green Light for Condos on Gravesend Bay

body: LEAD: Representative Mario Biaggi, Democrat of the Bronx, and Meade H. Esposito, the former Brooklyn Democratic leader, were found guilty yesterday of Federal charges involving unlawful gratuities but were acquitted of a more serious charge of bribery and of conspiracy to commit bribery. Representative Mario Biaggi, Democrat of the Bronx, and Meade
title: BIAGGI, ESPOSITO CONVICTED ON GIFT BUT NOT ON BRIBE

body: LEAD: Mayor Koch yesterday gave final approval for a cable television company to begin wiring for one million homes in the Bronx and eastern Brooklyn, a project long delayed by criminal investigations into bidding for New York City's cable franchises. Mayor Koch yesterday gave final approval for a cable television company to begin wiring for one
title: Koch Clears Cable TV Work For Brooklyn and the Bronx

body: LEAD: State cable television officials agreed yesterday to supersede New York City and authorize a Long Island utility to start wiring one million homes in the Bronx and eastern Brooklyn. title: State to Act on Cable TV In Brooklyn and Bronx

body: LEAD: In a secretly recorded telephone conversation played in court yesterday, Meade H. Esposito, the former Brooklyn Democratic leader, was heard making arrangements for a 1985 Florida vacation for Representative Mario Biaggi and a companion and to have the bill paid by a printing company controlled by Mr. In a secretly recorded telephone
title: Biaggi 'Arrangement' Heard on Tape

body: LEAD: A PLAQUE at the end of the Canarsie Pier is inscribed with the words of Henry Meyer, a 19th-century developer: ''Jamaica Bay awaits the touch of the magic wand that will transform it into the Wonder Harbor of the World.'' title: Ripples of Change Flutter on Jamaica Bay

body: LEAD: A missing 20-foot pleasure boat was found sunk and possibly stripped in Jamaica Bay yesterday, but divers saw no sign of the passengers who reportedly screamed and blew S O S whistles, the Coast Guard said. title: Coast Guard Finds No Bodies On a Missing Pleasure Boat

title: OFFICIALS CITE 22 FOOD OUTLETS

body: LEAD: Two longtime friends from opposite ends of New York City, Representative Mario Biaggi and Meade H. Esposito, who were indicted yesterday, are among the most powerful behind-the-scenes politicians in New York.
